KALE_TASKS.description: Maintain consistent soil moisture for tender leaves. Drought stress makes leaves tough and bitter.

KALE_TASKS.name: Heavy Feeding Program
KALE_TASKS.description: Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizer weekly for first month, then balanced fertilizer. Kale is a heavy feeder.

KALE_TASKS.name: Pest Management
KALE_TASKS.description: Monitor for cabbage worms, aphids, and flea beetles. Use row covers or organic controls as needed.

KALE_TASKS.name: Harvest Cut-and-Come-Again
KALE_TASKS.description: Harvest outer leaves when 15-20cm long, leaving center to continue growing. Regular harvesting encourages new growth.

KALE_TASKS.name: Leaf Processing
KALE_TASKS.description: Wash leaves thoroughly and use fresh. Can be massaged for salads or cooked. Excellent for dehydrating.

GOTUKOLA_TASKS.name: Moist Shade Area Preparation
GOTUKOLA_TASKS.description: Prepare partially shaded area with consistently moist, fertile soil. Gotukola thrives in humid, tropical conditions.

GOTUKOLA_TASKS.name: Runner or Seed Planting
GOTUKOLA_TASKS.description: Plant runners or seeds in moist soil. Space 15cm apart to allow for spreading growth habit.

GOTUKOLA_TASKS.name: High Moisture Maintenance
GOTUKOLA_TASKS.description: Keep soil consistently moist to wet. Gotukola naturally grows in marshy areas and needs constant moisture.

GOTUKOLA_TASKS.name: Organic Matter Addition
GOTUKOLA_TASKS.description: Add compost or organic matter monthly. Avoid chemical fertilizers as this is a medicinal plant.

GOTUKOLA_TASKS.name: Runner Management
GOTUKOLA_TASKS.description: Allow runners to spread but contain within designated area. Remove flowers to focus energy on leaf production.

GOTUKOLA_TASKS.name: Continuous Leaf Harvest
GOTUKOLA_TASKS.description: Harvest young, tender leaves regularly. Pick in early morning when leaves are at peak moisture content.

GOTUKOLA_TASKS.name: Fresh Use Processing
GOTUKOLA_TASKS.description: Use leaves fresh for salads or juice. Can be dried for tea but fresh is preferred for maximum nutrition.

MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.name: Native Plant Bed Preparation
MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.description: Prepare well-drained soil in partial shade. This native Sri Lankan green thrives in local conditions with minimal input.

MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.name: Seed or Cutting Planting
MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.description: Plant seeds or cuttings 20cm apart. Best planted during rainy season for natural establishment.

MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.name: Natural Rainfall Watering
MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.description: Water lightly during dry periods. Mukunuwenna is drought-tolerant once established.

MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.name: Minimal Fertilizing
MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.description: Apply light compost monthly. Avoid over-fertilizing as this native plant prefers natural conditions.

MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.name: Natural Pest Resistance
MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.description: Monitor for any unusual pest issues. Mukunuwenna naturally resists most local pests.

MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.name: Regular Leaf Picking
MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.description: Pick young leaves and tender tips regularly. Regular harvesting encourages bushy growth.

MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.name: Traditional Preparation
MUKUNUWENNA_TASKS.description: Use fresh in traditional curry preparations. Can be dried for preservation but fresh is preferred.

KANKUN_TASKS.name: Water-Rich Soil Preparation
KANKUN_TASKS.description: Prepare very moist to marshy soil conditions. Kankun (water spinach) naturally grows in wet areas.

KANKUN_TASKS.name: Cutting or Seed Planting
KANKUN_TASKS.description: Plant cuttings or seeds in waterlogged soil. Space 15cm apart to allow for rapid spreading growth.

KANKUN_TASKS.name: Constant Water Supply
KANKUN_TASKS.description: Maintain waterlogged conditions constantly. Kankun requires standing water or consistently saturated soil.

KANKUN_TASKS.name: Rapid Growth Management
KANKUN_TASKS.description: Control rapid spreading by harvesting regularly. Kankun can quickly take over an area if not managed.

KANKUN_TASKS.name: Organic Feeding
KANKUN_TASKS.description: Add liquid compost to water weekly. The aquatic nature allows for liquid fertilizer application.

KANKUN_TASKS.name: Frequent Cutting Harvest
KANKUN_TASKS.description: Cut stems and leaves frequently, leaving 5cm above water level. Harvesting every 2-3 weeks.

KANKUN_TASKS.name: Fresh Cooking Use
KANKUN_TASKS.description: Use immediately after harvest in stir-fries and curries. Best when used within hours of cutting.

SARANA_TASKS.name: Root Crop Soil Preparation
SARANA_TASKS.description: Prepare deep, loose soil for root development. Mix compost thoroughly to ensure good tuber formation.

SARANA_TASKS.name: Tuber or Crown Planting
SARANA_TASKS.description: Plant tubers or crown divisions 25cm apart and 5cm deep. Plant during beginning of rainy season.

SARANA_TASKS.name: Consistent Moisture Management
SARANA_TASKS.description: Maintain consistent soil moisture throughout growing season. Avoid waterlogging which causes tuber rot.

SARANA_TASKS.name: Organic Fertilizer Application
SARANA_TASKS.description: Apply aged compost monthly. Use balanced NPK fertilizer every 6 weeks during active growth.

SARANA_TASKS.name: Leaf Harvest for Greens
SARANA_TASKS.description: Harvest young leaves periodically for cooking greens while tubers develop underground.

SARANA_TASKS.name: Tuber Harvest
SARANA_TASKS.description: Harvest tubers when leaves begin to yellow and die back. Dig carefully to avoid damage.

SARANA_TASKS.name: Traditional Processing
SARANA_TASKS.description: Clean and prepare tubers according to traditional methods. Can be cooked fresh or dried for storage.

BASIL_TASKS.name: Herb Garden Preparation
BASIL_TASKS.description: Prepare well-draining soil in sunny location with afternoon shade protection. Basil needs warmth but protection from intense sun.

BASIL_TASKS.name: Seedling Transplanting
BASIL_TASKS.description: Transplant seedlings 20cm apart when 6-8cm tall. Plant after last cool period for best growth.

BASIL_TASKS.name: Regular Watering
BASIL_TASKS.description: Water regularly but avoid overhead watering to prevent fungal diseases. Water at soil level.

BASIL_TASKS.name: Balanced Feeding
BASIL_TASKS.description: Apply balanced organic fertilizer bi-weekly. Avoid high nitrogen which reduces essential oil concentration.

BASIL_TASKS.name: Flower Pinching
BASIL_TASKS.description: Pinch flower buds regularly to encourage leafy growth and prevent bolting. This maintains leaf quality.

BASIL_TASKS.name: Continuous Leaf Harvest
BASIL_TASKS.description: Harvest leaves regularly by pinching stems just above leaf pairs. Regular harvesting encourages bushier growth.

BASIL_TASKS.name: Fresh Use and Drying
BASIL_TASKS.description: Use fresh leaves immediately or dry in shade for preservation. Essential oils are highest just before flowering.

MINT_TASKS.name: Moist Soil Area Preparation
MINT_TASKS.description: Prepare consistently moist soil in partial shade. Mint spreads rapidly so consider container growing or barriers.

MINT_TASKS.name: Runner or Cutting Planting
MINT_TASKS.description: Plant runners or cuttings 25cm apart. Mint establishes quickly from cuttings and spreads via runners.

MINT_TASKS.name: High Moisture Maintenance
MINT_TASKS.description: Keep soil consistently moist. Mint requires more water than most herbs and thrives in humid conditions.

MINT_TASKS.name: Containment Management
MINT_TASKS.description: Control spreading by harvesting runners or using physical barriers. Mint can quickly overtake garden areas.

MINT_TASKS.name: Light Organic Feeding
MINT_TASKS.description: Apply light compost monthly. Over-fertilizing reduces essential oil concentration in leaves.

MINT_TASKS.name: Regular Harvesting
MINT_TASKS.description: Harvest sprigs regularly by cutting stems just above leaf pairs. Best harvested in morning when oils are concentrated.

MINT_TASKS.name: Fresh Use and Preservation
MINT_TASKS.description: Use fresh immediately or dry in shade. Can be frozen in ice cubes for drinks. Essential oils highest before flowering.

CORIANDER_TASKS.name: Cool Season Soil Preparation
CORIANDER_TASKS.description: Prepare well-draining soil in location with morning sun, afternoon shade. Coriander bolts quickly in heat.

CORIANDER_TASKS.name: Direct Seeding
CORIANDER_TASKS.description: Sow seeds directly 1cm deep, 10cm apart. Coriander doesn't transplant well due to taproot.

CORIANDER_TASKS.name: Gentle Daily Watering
CORIANDER_TASKS.description: Water gently to maintain moisture without disturbing shallow roots. Avoid overhead watering once established.

CORIANDER_TASKS.name: Succession Planting
CORIANDER_TASKS.description: Plant new seeds every 2-3 weeks for continuous harvest as coriander has short harvest window before bolting.

CORIANDER_TASKS.name: Light Fertilizing
CORIANDER_TASKS.description: Apply light, balanced fertilizer once. Over-fertilizing causes rapid bolting and reduced flavor.

CORIANDER_TASKS.name: Bolting Prevention
CORIANDER_TASKS.description: Monitor for flower formation and harvest immediately if bolting begins. Hot weather triggers rapid flowering.

CORIANDER_TASKS.name: Leaf Harvesting
CORIANDER_TASKS.description: Harvest outer leaves when plants are 10-15cm tall. Cut in early morning for best flavor and longevity.

CORIANDER_TASKS.name: Seed Collection
CORIANDER_TASKS.description: Allow some plants to flower and collect seeds when brown and aromatic for cooking spice.

PARSLEY_TASKS.name: Rich Soil Preparation
PARSLEY_TASKS.description: Prepare deep, rich soil with good organic content. Parsley has long taproot and needs fertile conditions.

PARSLEY_TASKS.name: Slow Seed Germination
PARSLEY_TASKS.description: Soak seeds overnight before planting. Sow 1cm deep, 15cm apart. Germination can take 2-4 weeks.

PARSLEY_TASKS.name: Patient Watering
PARSLEY_TASKS.description: Keep soil consistently moist during long germination period. Don't give up - parsley is notoriously slow to germinate.

PARSLEY_TASKS.name: Established Plant Watering
PARSLEY_TASKS.description: Water regularly but avoid waterlogging. Established parsley is quite drought tolerant.

PARSLEY_TASKS.name: Monthly Fertilizing
PARSLEY_TASKS.description: Apply balanced fertilizer monthly. Parsley benefits from consistent nutrition for continuous leaf production.

PARSLEY_TASKS.name: Outer Leaf Harvesting
PARSLEY_TASKS.description: Harvest outer leaves regularly, leaving center crown intact. This encourages continued production.

PARSLEY_TASKS.name: Fresh Use and Drying
PARSLEY_TASKS.description: Use fresh immediately for best flavor. Can be dried but loses significant flavor compared to fresh use.

LEMONGRASS_TASKS.name: Clump Planting Area Preparation
LEMONGRASS_TASKS.description: Prepare well-draining soil in sunny location. Lemongrass grows in clumps and needs space to spread.

LEMONGRASS_TASKS.name: Division or Stalk Planting
LEMONGRASS_TASKS.description: Plant divisions or stalks with roots 60cm apart. Lemongrass establishes quickly from divisions.

LEMONGRASS_TASKS.name: Regular Watering
LEMONGRASS_TASKS.description: Water regularly during establishment, then reduce as lemongrass becomes quite drought tolerant.

LEMONGRASS_TASKS.name: Clump Division
LEMONGRASS_TASKS.description: Divide clumps every 6 months to prevent overcrowding and maintain vigorous growth.

LEMONGRASS_TASKS.name: Organic Matter Addition
LEMONGRASS_TASKS.description: Add compost around clumps every 3 months. Lemongrass responds well to organic matter.

LEMONGRASS_TASKS.name: Stalk Harvesting
LEMONGRASS_TASKS.description: Harvest outer stalks when 30cm tall by cutting at base. Leave center stalks to continue growing.

LEMONGRASS_TASKS.name: Fresh and Dried Processing
LEMONGRASS_TASKS.description: Use fresh stalks immediately or dry leaves for tea. Stalks can be frozen whole for cooking use.

ALOE_VERA_TASKS.name: Succulent Soil Preparation
ALOE_VERA_TASKS.description: Prepare extremely well-draining soil mix: 50% regular soil, 30% sand, 20% gravel. Aloe vera requires excellent drainage.

ALOE_VERA_TASKS.name: Offset or Plant Installation
ALOE_VERA_TASKS.description: Plant offsets or established plants in shallow holes. Plant at same depth as original container.

ALOE_VERA_TASKS.name: Minimal Watering
ALOE_VERA_TASKS.description: Water sparingly only when soil is completely dry. Overwatering is the main cause of aloe vera failure.

ALOE_VERA_TASKS.name: Drought Period Watering
ALOE_VERA_TASKS.description: During extreme drought, water lightly once every 2 weeks. Aloe vera stores water in leaves.

ALOE_VERA_TASKS.name: No Fertilizer Policy
ALOE_VERA_TASKS.description: Avoid fertilizing. Aloe vera thrives in poor soil and fertilizer can cause root rot and reduced medicinal properties.

ALOE_VERA_TASKS.name: Offset Management
ALOE_VERA_TASKS.description: Remove offsets to prevent overcrowding or allow them to form colonies. Offsets can be replanted.

ALOE_VERA_TASKS.name: Medicinal Leaf Harvest
ALOE_VERA_TASKS.description: Harvest outer, mature leaves by cutting at base. Only harvest from plants over 2 years old.

ALOE_VERA_TASKS.name: Gel Extraction
ALOE_VERA_TASKS.description: Extract gel immediately after cutting. Fresh gel has highest medicinal potency. Can be preserved in refrigerator.

CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.name: Tree Planting Site Preparation
CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.description: Prepare well-draining soil in protected location. Curry leaf tree needs protection from strong winds.

CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.name: Sapling or Cutting Planting
CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.description: Plant saplings or large cuttings at beginning of rainy season. Space 2m apart if planting multiple trees.

CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.name: Establishment Watering
CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.description: Water regularly during first year to establish strong root system. Critical for tree establishment.

CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.name: Mature Tree Watering
CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.description: Water during dry periods once established. Mature curry leaf trees are quite drought tolerant.

CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.name: Organic Fertilizer Application
CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.description: Apply aged compost every 3 months. Use balanced NPK fertilizer during active growing season.

CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.name: Pruning for Shape
CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.description: Prune to maintain shape and encourage bushy growth. Regular pruning increases leaf production.

CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.name: Fresh Leaf Harvesting
CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.description: Harvest fresh leaves and young shoots regularly. Regular harvesting encourages new growth.

CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.name: Fresh Use Processing
CURLY_LEAVES_TASKS.description: Use leaves fresh immediately for best flavor. Can be dried but fresh leaves have superior aroma and taste.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Deep Soil Preparation
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Prepare deep, well-draining soil. Moringa develops long taproot and needs good drainage to prevent root rot.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Seed or Cutting Planting
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Plant seeds 2cm deep or use cuttings. Space 2-3m apart as moringa grows quickly into large tree.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Young Tree Watering
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Water regularly for first 6 months. Once established, moringa is extremely drought tolerant.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Mature Tree Watering
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Water only during extended dry periods. Overwatering mature moringa can cause root problems.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Light Fertilizing
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Apply light compost annually. Moringa grows well in poor soil and too much fertilizer reduces leaf quality.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Regular Pruning
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Prune regularly to keep tree at manageable height and encourage leaf production. Moringa responds well to pruning.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Leaf Harvesting
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Harvest young leaves and tender stems regularly. Best nutritional value in young, tender leaves.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Pod Harvesting
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Harvest young pods when 30-40cm long for cooking. Allow some pods to mature for seeds.

MORINGA_TASKS.name: Drying and Processing
MORINGA_TASKS.description: Dry leaves in shade for powder production. Fresh leaves best for cooking. Process pods fresh or dry seeds.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Large Tree Site Preparation
NEEM_TASKS.description: Prepare large area with well-draining soil. Neem grows into very large tree requiring substantial space.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Sapling Planting
NEEM_TASKS.description: Plant neem saplings during monsoon season. Plant at same depth as nursery container.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Establishment Watering
NEEM_TASKS.description: Water regularly for first 2 years to establish deep root system. Critical for tree survival.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Drought Tolerant Maintenance
NEEM_TASKS.description: Water only during extreme drought once established. Neem is extremely drought tolerant.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Minimal Fertilizing
NEEM_TASKS.description: Apply compost annually around base. Neem grows well in poor soil and doesn't require intensive feeding.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Structural Pruning
NEEM_TASKS.description: Prune for good structure and to maintain size. Remove dead wood and crossing branches.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Leaf Collection for Medicine
NEEM_TASKS.description: Collect leaves for medicinal use. Best collected in morning when active compounds are highest.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Seed Harvesting
NEEM_TASKS.description: Collect ripe fruits for seeds which are used for oil extraction and medicinal purposes.

NEEM_TASKS.name: Traditional Processing
NEEM_TASKS.description: Dry leaves for powder or prepare oils. Process according to traditional Ayurvedic methods.

BRAHMI_TASKS.name: Aquatic Environment Preparation
BRAHMI_TASKS.description: Prepare shallow water feature or consistently waterlogged soil. Brahmi is an aquatic/semi-aquatic plant.

BRAHMI_TASKS.name: Cutting or Division Planting
BRAHMI_TASKS.description: Plant cuttings or divisions in water or very wet soil. Brahmi establishes quickly from cuttings.

BRAHMI_TASKS.name: Constant Water Maintenance
BRAHMI_TASKS.description: Maintain constant water level or waterlogged soil. Brahmi cannot survive in dry conditions.

BRAHMI_TASKS.name: Spreading Control
BRAHMI_TASKS.description: Control spreading by harvesting regularly or using barriers. Brahmi spreads rapidly in ideal conditions.

BRAHMI_TASKS.name: Organic Water Fertilizing
BRAHMI_TASKS.description: Add liquid compost to water monthly. Avoid chemical fertilizers for this medicinal plant.

BRAHMI_TASKS.name: Medicinal Leaf Harvest
BRAHMI_TASKS.description: Harvest leaves and tender stems regularly for medicinal use. Morning harvest when compounds are concentrated.

BRAHMI_TASKS.name: Ayurvedic Processing
BRAHMI_TASKS.description: Process fresh or dry according to Ayurvedic methods. Fresh juice is most potent for medicinal use.

ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.name: Well-Drained Soil Preparation
ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.description: Prepare well-draining, slightly alkaline soil in sunny location. Ashwagandha is drought tolerant but needs good drainage.

ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.name: Seed Sowing
ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.description: Sow seeds 1cm deep, 30cm apart. Plant during warm season when soil temperature is consistently warm.

ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.name: Germination Watering
ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.description: Water lightly until germination and establishment. Avoid overwatering which can cause root rot.

ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.name: Drought Management
ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.description: Water only during extended dry periods once established. Ashwagandha thrives with minimal water.

ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.name: Minimal Fertilizing
ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.description: Apply light compost once during growing season. Excessive fertilizer reduces medicinal potency.

ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.name: Plant Health Monitoring
ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.description: Monitor for any pest or disease issues. Ashwagandha is generally pest-resistant but check regularly.

ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.name: Root Harvesting
ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.description: Harvest roots when plant reaches maturity and begins to yellow. Roots are the primary medicinal part.

ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.name: Root Processing
ASHWAGANDHA_TASKS.description: Clean, dry, and process roots according to traditional methods. Proper drying is crucial for medicinal quality.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Large Space Planning
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Plan for very large mature tree (15-20m). Choose permanent location with ample space and deep soil.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Root Sucker Selection
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Select healthy root suckers from productive mother trees. Breadfruit doesn't grow true from seed.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Sucker Transplanting
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Transplant root suckers during rainy season. Handle roots carefully to avoid damage.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Heavy Initial Watering
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Intensive watering during establishment. Breadfruit needs abundant water for first 2 years.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Wind Protection Setup
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Install wind barriers for young trees. Breadfruit has large leaves vulnerable to wind damage.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Rich Organic Feeding
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Heavy feeding with compost and organic matter. Breadfruit is a very heavy feeder requiring rich nutrition.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Rapid Growth Management
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Monitor extremely rapid growth. Breadfruit can grow 2-3m per year under good conditions.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Structural Pruning
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Prune for strong branch structure. Remove competing leaders and weak branches.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: First Fruiting Watch
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Watch for first fruits (3-4 years). Young trees may fruit earlier than expected.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Fruit Support Installation
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Support heavy fruit clusters to prevent branch breakage. Fruits can weigh 2-4kg each.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Harvest Management
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Harvest fruits at proper maturity stage. Use long poles with cutting tools for high fruits.

BREADFRUIT_TASKS.name: Processing for Storage
BREADFRUIT_TASKS.description: Process fruits immediately - cook, dry, or preserve. Fresh breadfruit has very short storage life.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Massive Tree Planning
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Plan for extremely large mature tree (20-25m). Choose permanent site with space for enormous canopy.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Grafted Sapling Source
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Source grafted saplings of good varieties. Seedling trees take much longer to fruit and quality varies.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Deep Soil Preparation
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Prepare very deep, fertile soil. Jackfruit develops massive root system requiring deep preparation.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Sapling Planting
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Plant grafted sapling during rainy season. Handle root system very carefully during transplanting.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Establishment Care
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Intensive care during establishment phase. Water, mulch, and protect from competition for first 2 years.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Early Growth Support
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Support young tree with stakes and wind protection. Train single strong leader.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Heavy Feeding Program
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Intensive feeding with aged organic matter. Jackfruit requires enormous amounts of nutrition.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Canopy Development
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Monitor canopy development and structure. Guide branch development for strong framework.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Pest Prevention
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Monitor for shoot borers, fruit borers, and scale insects. Prevention better than treatment.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: First Flowering Observation
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Watch for first flowering (3-5 years for grafted trees). Flowers appear directly on trunk and branches.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Fruit Thinning
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Thin young fruits to prevent branch breakage. Mature jackfruits can weigh 10-25kg each.

JACKFRUIT_TASKS.name: Harvest Planning
JACKFRUIT_TASKS.description: Plan harvest logistics for huge fruits. Require special equipment and multiple people for harvesting.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Cutting Propagation Setup
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Prepare semi-hardwood cuttings from healthy mother plants. Use hormone rooting powder for better success.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Nursery Establishment
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Set up shaded nursery area with well-draining potting mix. Cinnamon needs protected establishment.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Cutting Planting
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Plant rooted cuttings in nursery pots. Maintain high humidity and consistent moisture.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Rooting Period Care
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Careful watering and humidity management during rooting (6-8 weeks). Critical establishment period.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Transplant Preparation
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Prepare permanent planting sites with well-draining, organic-rich soil in partial shade.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Field Transplanting
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Transplant rooted cuttings to permanent locations. Space 1.5m apart for bush cultivation.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Establishment Watering
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Regular watering during establishment in field. Reduce gradually as plants establish.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Organic Feeding
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Light monthly feeding with aged compost. Cinnamon grows well with minimal feeding.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Coppicing Management
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Cut plants to ground level after 2 years to encourage straight shoots for bark harvesting.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Shoot Development
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Monitor new shoot development after coppicing. Select best shoots for bark production.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: First Bark Harvest
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Begin harvesting bark from 2-year-old shoots. Best quality bark from young, straight shoots.

CINNAMON_TASKS.name: Bark Processing
CINNAMON_TASKS.description: Process harvested bark immediately - scrape, dry, and cure. Traditional methods for best quality.

DILL_TASKS.name: Direct Seeding Prep
DILL_TASKS.description: Prepare fine, well-draining soil. Dill doesn't transplant well, must be direct seeded.

DILL_TASKS.name: Seed Sowing
DILL_TASKS.description: Sow seeds thinly, barely covering with soil. Plant during cool season for best results.

DILL_TASKS.name: Gentle Germination Care
DILL_TASKS.description: Mist gently to keep soil surface moist. Germination in 7-14 days.

DILL_TASKS.name: Careful Thinning
DILL_TASKS.description: Thin to 15cm spacing when seedlings are 5cm tall. Use thinned plants immediately.

DILL_TASKS.name: Light Watering
DILL_TASKS.description: Water lightly and regularly. Avoid overwatering which causes weak, spindly growth.

DILL_TASKS.name: Minimal Feeding
DILL_TASKS.description: Very light feeding once. Over-feeding reduces essential oil content.

DILL_TASKS.name: Wind Protection
DILL_TASKS.description: Protect from strong winds. Dill has delicate foliage easily damaged by wind.

DILL_TASKS.name: Fresh Leaf Harvest
DILL_TASKS.description: Begin harvesting young leaves when plants are 15cm tall. Cut outer leaves regularly.

DILL_TASKS.name: Flower Prevention
DILL_TASKS.description: Pinch flower buds to prolong leaf harvest. Allow some plants to flower for seed harvest.

DILL_TASKS.name: Seed Harvest
DILL_TASKS.description: Harvest seeds when brown and aromatic. Cut entire seed heads and dry thoroughly.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Deep Soil Preparation
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Prepare deep, fertile soil with good drainage. Fennel develops long taproot requiring deep cultivation.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Direct Seeding
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Direct seed 1.5cm deep in rows 30cm apart. Fennel doesn't transplant well due to taproot.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Germination Monitoring
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Monitor for germination (10-14 days). Protect seedlings from intense tropical sun.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Seedling Thinning
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Thin to 20cm spacing when seedlings are 10cm tall. Use thinned plants for immediate cooking.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Deep Watering
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Deep, regular watering to support taproot development. Consistent moisture prevents bolting.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Organic Feeding
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Monthly application of balanced organic fertilizer. Fennel benefits from steady nutrition.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Bulb Development Watch
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Monitor for bulb formation at base of plant (Florence fennel varieties only).

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Leaf Harvest
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Harvest feathery leaves for cooking throughout growing season. Cut outer leaves regularly.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Bulb Harvest
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Harvest bulbs when tennis ball-sized (Florence fennel). Cut at soil level, leave roots.

FENNEL_TASKS.name: Seed Collection
FENNEL_TASKS.description: Allow some plants to flower and set seed. Harvest when seeds are brown and aromatic.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Cool Season Timing
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Plan for cool-dry season planting (Nov-Feb). Prepare well-draining soil with organic matter.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Seed Soaking
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Soak seeds overnight in water to improve germination rate. Fenugreek seeds have hard coat.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Broadcasting Seeds
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Broadcast seeds thinly and rake lightly into soil. Can also sow in rows 20cm apart.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Germination Care
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Keep soil moist during germination (7-10 days). Light watering to avoid washing away seeds.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Thinning Process
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Thin overcrowded areas to 10cm spacing. Use thinned seedlings as microgreens.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Moderate Watering
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Regular but moderate watering. Fenugreek is somewhat drought tolerant once established.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Light Feeding
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Single application of balanced fertilizer. Avoid over-feeding which reduces seed quality.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Leaf Harvest
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Begin harvesting young leaves for vegetables when plants are 15cm tall.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Flowering Monitoring
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Monitor for flowering. Stop leaf harvest when flowers appear to allow seed development.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Pod Development
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Watch pod development after flowering. Pods contain valuable fenugreek seeds.

FENUGREEK_TASKS.name: Seed Harvest
FENUGREEK_TASKS.description: Harvest pods when brown and dry. Thresh to extract seeds for culinary and medicinal use.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Substrate Preparation
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Prepare rice straw or sawdust substrate. Chop, soak, and sterilize by boiling for 30 minutes.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Spawn Procurement
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Source fresh oyster mushroom spawn from reliable supplier. Use within 1 week of purchase.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Inoculation Process
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Mix spawn with cooled substrate in clean conditions. Pack into plastic bags with holes for air exchange.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Incubation Setup
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Place inoculated bags in dark, humid area (80-85% humidity, 25-28°C). Perfect for Sri Lankan climate.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Mycelium Development
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Monitor white mycelium growth throughout substrate (10-14 days). Maintain high humidity.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Fruiting Initiation
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Move colonized bags to fruiting area with indirect light and fresh air circulation.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Pin Formation Monitoring
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Watch for tiny mushroom pins forming (3-5 days after fruiting initiation). Mist regularly.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Growth Period Care
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Maintain humidity by misting 2-3 times daily. Ensure good air circulation to prevent contamination.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: First Harvest
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Harvest mushroom clusters when caps are 5-10cm diameter. Cut at base with clean knife.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Second Flush Preparation
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Rest bags for 7-10 days, then resume misting for second flush of mushrooms.

OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.name: Continuous Harvesting
OYSTER_MUSHROOM_TASKS.description: Continue harvesting subsequent flushes every 7-10 days for 2-3 months total production.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Log Selection
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Select fresh hardwood logs (jak, mango, etc.) 10-15cm diameter. Cut during dry season for best results.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Log Preparation
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Cut logs to 1m lengths, drill holes 2cm deep every 15cm. Allow logs to dry for 2-4 weeks.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Spawn Inoculation
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Insert shiitake spawn into drilled holes. Seal with wax to prevent contamination and moisture loss.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Incubation Period
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Stack inoculated logs in shaded area. Cover with shade cloth but allow air circulation.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Mycelium Colonization
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Monitor for mycelium growth (6-12 months). Keep logs moist but not waterlogged during monsoon.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Soaking Process
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Soak colonized logs in water for 12-24 hours to initiate fruiting. Do this after dry periods.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Fruiting Setup
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Place soaked logs in fruiting area with 80% shade and good humidity control.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Mushroom Development
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Monitor mushroom development after soaking (7-14 days). Maintain consistent humidity.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Harvest Timing
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Harvest when caps are 80% open but edges still slightly curled under. Cut with sharp knife.

SHIITAKE_TASKS.name: Log Maintenance
SHIITAKE_TASKS.description: Rest logs between fruiting cycles. Maintain moisture and continue soaking cycles for 2-3 years.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Trellis Construction
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Build strong trellis system 2m high. Bitter gourd vines are vigorous climbers needing substantial support.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Seed Treatment
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Soak seeds 24 hours, then crack seed coat lightly. This improves germination of hard bitter gourd seeds.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Hill Planting
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Plant 3-4 seeds per hill, 2m apart along trellis. Plant during warm season for best growth.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Germination Care
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Keep soil consistently moist during germination (7-14 days). Protect from heavy rain.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Seedling Selection
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Thin to 2 strongest seedlings per hill when 15cm tall. Train vines to climb trellis.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Vine Training
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Guide main vines up trellis, allow side branches to spread. Secure with soft ties.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Rich Feeding
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Apply rich compost monthly. Bitter gourd is a heavy feeder requiring abundant nutrition.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Pollination Assistance
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Hand pollinate female flowers if natural pollination is poor. Use male flowers from same plant.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Young Fruit Harvest
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Begin harvesting young, tender fruits when 10-15cm long. Daily harvest encourages continued production.

BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.name: Pest Management
BITTER_GOURD_TASKS.description: Monitor for fruit flies, aphids, and powdery mildew. Use organic controls as needed.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Strong Support Setup
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Build very strong trellis or pergola. Bottle gourds can produce fruits weighing 5-10kg each.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Large Hill Preparation
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Prepare large planting hills 1m diameter with rich compost. Space hills 3m apart.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Seed Planting
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Plant 4-5 seeds per hill, 3cm deep. Plant during warm season for vigorous growth.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Abundant Watering
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Provide abundant water throughout growing season. Bottle gourd needs large amounts of water.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Vigorous Growth Management
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Thin to 2-3 strongest vines per hill. Train main vines up support structure.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Heavy Feeding
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Very heavy feeding with compost and organic matter. Apply large quantities monthly.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Fruit Support
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Support developing fruits with slings or platforms. Prevent fruits from breaking vines.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Young Vegetable Harvest
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Harvest young fruits (20-30cm) for vegetables. Allow some to mature for storage containers.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Mature Gourd Harvest
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Harvest mature gourds when skin hardens and turns brown. Handle very carefully due to size and weight.

BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.name: Gourd Processing
BOTTLE_GOURD_TASKS.description: Clean and cure mature gourds for containers. Traditional processing methods for durability.
